value.name: Murder of Jesse Valencia - Wikipedia
value.snippet: The murder of Jesse Valencia occurred on June 5, 2004, in Columbia, Missouri . The murder was featured on the April 24, 2020, episode of Dateline NBC. [1] Victim [ edit] Jesse James Wade Valencia (February 22, 1981 – June 5, 2004) was born in Boyle County, Kentucky. He was one of three children, having two sisters.

value.snippet: Rios chased Jesse and quickly caught up, placing him in a chokehold and rendering him unconscious. He then cut Jesse’s throat and fled the scene. A jury found Rios guilty of first-degree murder and armed criminal action, which was later reversed due to the admission of two hearsay statements made by Valencia, according to court documents.

Although multiple suspects were identified in the ensuing years, the case remains unresolved to this date.

value.snippet: During the early hours of June 5, 2004, Jesse was murdered, and his body was discovered by students on the college lawn that morning. DNA under Jesse’s fingernails as well as arm hair both matched Rios. Furthermore, bruising on his body was also consistent with official police chokehold techniques. Therefore, Rios was arrested for the killing.
